alert.note: Alert for Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 5:38PM CDT until August 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM CDT, The Llano river through Mason County continues to rise due to heavy rainfall. Low water crossings and other low lying areas may see rising water and may remain impassable at times across much of Mason County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mason, Hedwigs Hill, Art, Grit, Hilda, Streeter, Katemcy, Loyal Valley, Fredonia, Long Mountain, Pontotoc, Koockville, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222 and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Oak Grove crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Vater crossing Hasse Creek, Old Pontotoc crossing Little Willow Creek, Old Union crossing, Hickory Grove crossing Elm Creek, Old Junction crossing Honey Creek and Spy Rock crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
